com.epidemic_simulator

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epidemic_simulator.Simulator

  • public final class Simulator
extends Object
    The Epidemic Simulator core class, it does all the Simulation-related stuff by handling the prosecution of days, the encounters and the disease status of every Person.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Simulator.Outcome
      Enum for the possible outcomes of a day execution.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double averageEncountersPerDay
      The average encounters per Person per day when everyone can move (V).
      int canInfectDay
      Days necessary for an infected green to turn yellow
      int cureCost
      The cost for curing a person for a day (3 * C)
      int deathRate
      The Death rate (L).
      int developSymptomsMaxDay
      The last day since the start of the disease in which a yellow could turn red.
      int diseaseDuration
      The Disease duration (D).
      int infectionRate
      The infection rate (I).
      long initialResources
      The initial resources (R).
      int startingPopulation
      The starting population (P).
      int symptomsRate
      The Symptoms rate (S).

      The test price (C).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCallBack(SimulatorCallBack callBack)
      Add a callback to the list of callbacks that will have their methods called in the right situations.
      void dispose()
      Unlink this Simulator from any data it has.
      On certain JVM versions it can allow for faster Garbage collection.
      It allows for lower RAM usages on multiple simulations, at the expenses of performances.
      Simulator.Outcome executeDay()
      Execute a day in the simulator.
      This method will:
      Make the people that can move, meet other people Make the disease status proceed for every one that has the disease Adjust resources according to who moved and who got cures
      List<Person> getAlivePopulation()
      Return a readOnly instance of the alive population list.
      Trying to edit the list in illegal ways will result in a RuntimeException
      (ex: deleting a red person so you don't need to heal them)
      int getBlackCount()
      Gets the number of black people.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      int getBlueCount()
      Gets the number of blue people.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      int getDay()
      Gets the number of days since the beginning of the simulation.
      int getGreenCount()
      Gets the number of green people.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      int getHealthy()
      Gets the number of healthy people.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      int getInfected()
      Gets the number of infected people.
      This includes green that have been infected.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      List<Person> getPopulation()
      Return a readOnly instance of the population list.
      Trying to edit the list in illegal ways will result in a RuntimeException
      (ex: deleting a red person so you don't need to heal them)
      double getR0()
      Gets the R0 factor.
      Mostly useless but it can be used for output logs.
      int getRedCount()
      Gets the number of red people.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      long getResources()
      Gets the current resources that this Simulator has.
      Strategy getStrategy()
      Get the Strategy currently linked to this Simulator.
      int getYellowCount()
      Gets the number of yellow people.
      It is illegal for strategies to access this.
      void removeCallBack(SimulatorCallBack callBack)
      Remove a callback to the list of callbacks that will have their methods called in the right situations.
      void setStrategy(Strategy strategy)
      Set the Strategy currently linked to this Simulator.
      boolean testVirus(Person person)
      This method test the virus inside a Person.
      The virus will only be detected if the Person it's already at a stage at which he can infect other people.

      NOTE: This method usually consume resources, but if the person to test already has Person.symptoms it will not waste resources.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(int startingPopulation,
                 long resources,
                 int testPrice,
                 double averageEncountersPerDay,
                 int infectionRate,
                 int symptomsRate,
                 int deathRate,
                 int diseaseDuration)
          throws InvalidSimulationException
        Create a simulator according to the parameters given.
        Parameters:
        startingPopulation - (P) The population of the simulation at the start.
        resources - (R) The economic resources available for this simulation.
        testPrice - (C) The cost of a test for this disease.
        averageEncountersPerDay - (V) The number of encounters that a person does in a day if everyone is allowed to move.
        infectionRate - (I) The percentage of possibility that an infected person can infect another one if they meet.
        symptomsRate - (S) The percentage of possibility that an infected person can develop symptoms.
        deathRate - (L) The percentage of possibility that a symptomatic person can die.
        diseaseDuration - (D) The number of days that the disease takes to heal;
        Throws:
        InvalidSimulationException - If the parameters are not in line with the rules of the simulation this exception will be thrown, please refer to the exception message for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • addCallBack

        public void addCallBack(SimulatorCallBack callBack)
        Add a callback to the list of callbacks that will have their methods called in the right situations.
        Parameters:
        callBack - the call back to add
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if you try to add a Strategy as a callback to a Simulator that already has one.

      • removeCallBack

        public void removeCallBack(SimulatorCallBack callBack)
        Remove a callback to the list of callbacks that will have their methods called in the right situations.
        Parameters:
        callBack - the call back to remove

      • getStrategy

        public Strategy getStrategy()
        Get the Strategy currently linked to this Simulator.
        Returns:
        the strategy

      • setStrategy

        public void setStrategy(Strategy strategy)
        Set the Strategy currently linked to this Simulator.
        Parameters:
        strategy - the strategy to link

      • getResources

        public long getResources()
        Gets the current resources that this Simulator has.
        Returns:
        the resources

      • getDay

        public int getDay()
        Gets the number of days since the beginning of the simulation. It can be useful for contact-tracing or for day-based activations of Strategy
        Returns:
        the day

      • getPopulation

        public List<Person> getPopulation()
        Return a readOnly instance of the population list.
        Trying to edit the list in illegal ways will result in a RuntimeException
        (ex: deleting a red person so you don't need to heal them)
        Returns:
        the population

      • getAlivePopulation

        public List<Person> getAlivePopulation()
        Return a readOnly instance of the alive population list.
        Trying to edit the list in illegal ways will result in a RuntimeException
        (ex: deleting a red person so you don't need to heal them)
        Returns:
        the alive population

      • getR0

        public double getR0()
        Gets the R0 factor.
        Mostly useless but it can be used for output logs.
        Returns:
        the r0

      • getHealthy

        public int getHealthy()
        Gets the number of healthy people.
        It is illegal for strategies to access this.
        Returns:
        the number of healthy people

      • getInfected

        public int getInfected()
        Gets the number of infected people.
        This includes green that have been infected.
        It is illegal for strategies to access this.
        Returns:
        the number of infected people

        Returns:

        public int getBlackCount()

        It is illegal for strategies to access this.
        Returns:
        the number of black people

      • executeDay

        public Simulator.Outcome executeDay()
        Execute a day in the simulator.
        This method will:
        • Make the people that can move, meet other people
        • Make the disease status proceed for every one that has the disease
        • Adjust resources according to who moved and who got cures
        Returns:
        the outcome of this day execution.
        See Also:
        Simulator.Outcome

      • testVirus

        public boolean testVirus(Person person)
        This method test the virus inside a Person.
        The virus will only be detected if the Person it's already at a stage at which he can infect other people.

        NOTE: This method usually consume resources, but if the person to test already has Person.symptoms it will not waste resources.
        Parameters:
        person - the person to test
        Returns:
        true if the virus is found, false if it's not found

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Unlink this Simulator from any data it has.
        On certain JVM versions it can allow for faster Garbage collection.
        It allows for lower RAM usages on multiple simulations, at the expenses of performances.
